author: Nigel Keeping
comment: Really good! Really really good. I've used it now for over three years which has highlighted my wants list. I'd like it to link to a shopping and kitchen storage app. I'd like it to let me assemble a weeks worth of connected menus and integrate it with my shopping list. But that's being picky. If you want a recipe app then look no further, you've found the best.

author: Kuno Baeriswyl
comment: I liked the app for its simplicity, however, premium subscription is too expensive and without the synchronization won't work. Furthermore, it seams that the meal planner feature isn't available anymore without sync.  To sum up, it's easy to manage your recipes. Good, light, nice design. But I stay uncertain about pricing politics and available features in the different available  subscriptions.

reply.author: Maadinfo Services
reply.content: Hi, recipes are not limited in the app but they are limited on our server mycookbook-online.net if you want to backup them to the cloud

author: Betty L
comment: So easy and beautiful to store and organize recipes. My favorite function is to go the recipe webpage, choose "share" to My Cookbook and the instructions and photos are imported in. All I have to do is add categories and tags. It even save the source HTML. Love this. The meal plan function is lame though. I mean... It works...but not very well integrated into the app. Hopefully, it'll improve in the future :)

author: Robin Koutchak
comment: Love this ~ import any recipe you Google over to this to save. Look up recipes from Food Network on Google, then hit share... Hit the My CookBook app and automatically imports with sections broken up for ingredients and instructions. Used this for a few years now.

author: Orla Christian
comment: Love it. One tiny flaw the the unislim recipes are not compatable to dl to the cookbook. I have a screenshot of what it says so if the makers of this want me to show them please respond with email address I can forward it to. When you fix it I'll update to 5*

author: Heidi Nebeker
comment: I've tried several cookbook apps, and this one is finally a keeper. I hate reading every bloggers blah blah blah, just give me a recipe that I can read quickly! Beautiful, clean, one page layout. You don't  have to click through multiple pages (like pintrest and yummly). Easy to find online recipes, though not all websites work (tops paprika because it imports nutrition and can have multiple pictures).  You can add notes or your own pics, great for customizing to your taste. You can type in or import hour own recipes (yummly can't ) and sharing recipes is easy (paprika doesn't allow exporting). I can't speak to the shopping list, but I do like having cloud storage so I can look my recipes up anywhere, including the grocery store parking lot. My one wish is that it would share with my fitness pal so I could easily add nutrition to my food tracking.

author: TPike777
comment: Why isn't this app compatible with YouTube? Are you serious!? So many recipes I try to import From YouTube and its like a 50/50 chance of working. Why do some work and others not? Fix it!

author: Ellen Pierson
comment: I really enjoy using this app. It is especially helpful when I am in the grocery store and I want to check a recipe to purchase ingredients. Only reason I didn't give a 5 is when I am cooking, using two recipes at a time, I wish I could easily go back and forth without having to look the recipes up each time. That would save me a lot of time. Otherwise, it is awesome.

Just plain works. Adding recipes couldn't be simpler, and using them is very easy to do, and they're easy to read. I don't leave reviews on apps, this is the only one I've cared enough to do. Love this app.

author: Danielle Downs
comment: It's a really useful app for pulling all your favourite recipes together in one place. Just a few minor bugs, like the sync not working fully with the browser version, but otherwise great app. Would actually give 4.5 but Google doesn't do half stars!

author: Wendy Marr
comment: Thought this was a great app until I got a new device and tried to import all my saved and created recipes. Everything is gone. What a disappointment.

author: Marcus Hamp
comment: This is really a very good recipe app. It's able to import recipes from a good number of web sources and if it can't import, it’s pretty quick and easy to add it manually. I use the premium version of this app to capture and rate recipes all the time. I use it in all of my devices and on the web and I have a membership. The premium version and membership are reasonably priced for the functionality. It's  definitely worth every penny.
title: Worth the price of premium.

author: Dottie Morgan
comment: Does what it says it will do.  Imports smoothly from many websites.  I especially like that I can import my recipes from Dropbox, thereby, having access to them on   all my devices.  Great feature when traveling.  Thanks!

author: Stephanie Bigwood
comment: My virtual cookbook! Better than Pinterest. I even have it synced to my husband's phone for when he's doing the grocery run. He even has a few of "his" recipes saved and will sometimes surprise me with dinner during busy season at work. LOVE this app and upgraded to paid version for weekly meal planning.

author: Benjamin terzin
comment: Good interface. I like that you can import recipes from the internet and make tghem your own! It also syncs up with web account so ypu can work with your recipes from multiple devices. I usually create recipes on my phone but use a tablet when making the dish.

author: John H.
comment: Simple, just what I needed   Simple to add, find and use recipes. Imports accurately from major recipe sites. Easy to cut and paste recipe items from others. Nice that recipes are accessible offline, but sync with other devices. Have it a 4, but it's between a 4 and a 5.

author: Alyssa Garcia
comment: I love this app because it makes out so easy too input all my own recipes so i dont forget them. It's perfect.

I luv this cookbook , easily takes recipies from internet and adds into ur book.  You can easily modify recepies and take pictures. Very easy and user friendly.  I greatly recommend this app!!!  Good cooking!!!😉
It's a great way to store and share recipes.

author: slick mcCool
comment: Great. Imports most recipes easily, easy to use in general. A little thought in to the categories goes a long way to browsing your list. I recommend this app

author: Kevin Clarke
comment: Excellent app. Really helps with meal planning.

author: Dana Danav
comment: A lot of features. Not compatible with some sites
I am really loving this app.! It has a lot of really great features for those who love cooking and planning meals to suit their tastes.

author: Adam L
comment: It is an extremely useful app for cooking. The share from Chrome feature to import recipes is wonderful. I use this app to store all of my recipes and when I'm cooking every day.

author: Matthew Morris
comment: I like the ease of use, the search/import feature, and ability to create a shopping list.

author: Gari Lawrence
comment: Great cook book app It will only download certain types of internet recipes, no option for copying from with blogs, articles.

author: Lisa Henderson
comment: Finally a place to organize all my recipes. Love the way it sets up the info you need without all the fluff you get on the web pages.

author: Viki Goaley
comment: Great for storing the recipes I actually use from all of my different cookbooks and magazines. Love that I can add custom tags for it as well

author: A J
comment: The feature that saves a recipe and strips out the ridiculously long backstory that people make up for every recipe is brilliant.
Not much use for it unless you pay....30 recipes and one Url a day on free app. Deleted it right away

author: Deborah McDaniel
comment: I have saved several recipes on this app.  It makes cooking new recipes easy and fun.

author: Catherine Wells
comment: Great, but the ads are annoying. Maybe worth paying to remove them.

author: J CD
comment: Love this app. Easy to use and UI is really simple and friendly. My only compliant is I wish it was easier to share recipes directly from the app.

author: Emily Diano
comment: Definitely the best free cookbook app out there, I went through a bunch

author: Mark Nicholas
comment: Does not work as advertised.

author: Eric von Bardeleben
comment: Would be even better if you added conversion tables for quantities, temperatures, etc. Wouldn't have to exit to convert.....

author: Reg Holmes
comment: I love this app! It's so easy to use and you can customize it into catagories! So useful!

author: Lynn Kosegi
comment: Love this app... so easy to import all those internet recipes that you'd otherwise lose.

author: kim mosteller
comment: Great app for all the recipes I find online but can't make til later.

author: Rebecca G
comment: I really like this app, but some websites aren't compatible.
